title: Modern Agriculture Technology: How Billions of Peaches Are Harvested and Processed by US Farmers

tasks.task: Farming operations in peach orchards and processing facilities.
subtasks: Planting peach trees in late winter or early spring.
Preparing soil with optimal pH levels.
Ensuring peach trees receive macronutrients and minerals.
Pruning peach trees to direct nutrients and manage canopy.
Hand harvesting peaches early in the morning.
Gently twisting peaches to detach them from branches without damage.
Sorting peaches into baskets or bins for transport.
Using specialized scales at packing facilities to sort peaches by weight.
Cooling harvested peaches to remove field heat.
Inspecting and washing peaches for freshness and cleanliness.
Sorting peaches by size and quality.
Blanching peaches in hot water to facilitate peeling.
Peeling peeled peaches to prepare them for slicing or pureeing.
Slicing or pitting peaches depending on the final product.
Producing canned peaches, syrup, dried peaches, or peach puree.
